required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hysteroscopy for Pregnancy of Unknown Location
clinical_study.official_title: Office Hysteroscopy as a Diagnostic Tool of Pregnancy of Unknown Location

lead_sponsor.agency: Shin Kong Wu Ho-Su Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.source: Shin Kong Wu Ho-Su Memorial Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: About 10% of early pregnancies can not be visualized by transvaginal ultrasound (TVU) on first visit and are classified as pregnancy of unknown location (PUL). The etiology includes ongoing intra-uterine pregnancy, failing pregnancy, or ectopic pregnancy. Early diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy is important because it allows conservative treatment. Serum β-hCG, D&C, and laparoscopy are routinely used as diagnostic methods. The purpose of the study is to evaluate if the less invasive office hysteroscopy (HSC) can help diagnose PUL.

detailed_description.textblock: If TVU showed no evidence of intra-uterine and extra-uterine pregnancy, a blood test for β-hCG was done. If β-hCG was < 1000 IU/L, the woman was followed with β-hCG 2 days later. Women with β-hCG > 1000 IU/L or abnormal β-hCG trend (increase < 66% or decrease < 15%) were offered HSC. If gestational tissues were visualized, ectopic pregnancy was ruled out. Otherwise, the tentative diagnosis was ectopic pregnancy.

primary_outcome.measure: percentage of women with PUL waived from laparoscopic examination

arm_group.description: pregnant women of at least 5 weeks by last menstrual period and transvaginal ultrasound did not revealed intra-uterine pregnancy or ectopic pregnancy Intervention: hysteroscope

intervention.description: Women of PUL with β-hCG > 1000 IU/L or abnormal β-hCG trend (increase < 66% or decrease < 15%) were offered HSC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women with PUL
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: Shin Kong Wu Ho-Su Memorial Hospital

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Shin-Kong Wu-Ho-Su Memerial Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shin Kong Wu Ho-Su Memorial Hospital
